title: Nosie Rides the Bus: Perfect for young readers (Nosie Adventures Book 2)
features: Do you remember how excited you were the very first time you rode the bus?  Jason is scared. Jason has to ride home from school every day with his Granny.  Luckily, Nosie is along for the ride. Jason and Nosie meet new people and have fun all the way home.  Perfect for young readers.  Lots of charming illustrations.
description: : "In the words of my four year old - Great!" "Highlyimaginative. Would make a great bedtime story." amazon.com/Nosie-Rides-Bus-Perfect-Adventures-ebook/dp/B01FGB589K/ref=sr_1_2?s=digital-text&ie=UTF8&qid=1464628774&sr=1-2&keywords=nosie+adventures

The idea for Nosie Adventures started because my husband always wanted to kiss my "nosie".He would tell me that the nosies-his and mine-would play and do amazing things during the day.  Before long, we were making up stories about the activities of the nosies. Did you know that your nose has a secret life?  I hope you will enjoy this book. Check out the first one too if you missed it.  Nosies spread positive messages of love and acceptance.
The Nosies have their own website(nosieadventures.com), Facebook and Twitter @nosieadv.  We (the Nosies and I) invite parents to send me ideas if there is a topic you want the Nosies to explore.

Linda Dezenski, the author of Nosie Adventures, set out to create a wayfor children to participate in an imaginary world in which their noses can helpthem as they tackle new activities and meet new people.  The Nosies areenthusiastic about everything they do, and they love all people.

Linda works at the John Edgar Thomson Foundation in Philadelphia. She is passionate about civilrights, particularly independent living for people with disabilities. Linda hastwo Masters degrees from Bryn Mawr College Graduate School of Social Work andSocial Research. Linda is the author of "Nosie Adventures" - achildren's book that teaches acceptance and diversity. Nosie Adventures isavailable for download on Kindle.
